gurmukhi: ਕਹੂੰ ਭੂਰ ਭਾਜੈ ॥ ਕਹੂੰ ਵੀਰ ਗਾਜੈ ॥ ਕਹੂੰ ਜੋਧ ਜੁੱਟੈ ॥ ਕਹੂੰ ਟੋਪ ਟੁੱਟੈ ॥੨੭੫॥
transliteration: Kahoon Bhoor Bhaajai|| Kahoon Veer Gadjai|| Kahoon Jodh Jouttai|| Kahoon Top Touttai||275||
translation: Somewhere the horses are running, somewhere the warriors are thundering; somewhere the heroic fighters are fighting and somewhere the warriors with breaking of their helmets are falling down.275.

gurmukhi: ਜਹਾਂ ਜੋਧ ਜੁੱਟੈ ॥ ਤਹਾਂ ਅਸਤ੍ਰ ਛੁੱਟੈ ॥ ਨ੍ਰਿਭੈ ਸ਼ਸਤ੍ਰ ਕੱਟੈ ॥ ਕਹੂੰ ਬੀਰ ਲੁੱਟੈ ॥੨੭੬॥
transliteration: Jahaan Jodh Jouttai|| Tahaan Astra Chhouttai|| Nribhai Shastra Kattai|| Kahoon Beer Louttai||276||
translation: Where the warriors have gathered, there they are striking the blows of their arms; they are fearlessly chopping with their weapons and killing the fighters.276.

gurmukhi: ਕਹੂੰ ਮਾਰ ਬੱਕੈ ॥ ਕਿਤੇ ਬਾਜ ੳੁਥੱਕੈ ॥ ਕਿਤੇ ਸੈਣ ਹੱਕੈ ॥ ਕਿਤੇ ਦਾਵ ਤੱਕੈ ॥੨੭੭॥
transliteration: Kahoon Maar Bakkai|| Kite Baaj Outhakkai|| Kite Sain Hakkai|| Kite Daav Takkai||277||
translation: Somewhere there are cries of “kill, kill”; and somewhere the horses are springing; somewhere seeing the opportunity the army is being removed.277.

gurmukhi: ਕਿਤੇ ਘਾੲਿ ਮੇਲੈ ॥ ਕਿਤੇ ਸੈਣ ਪੇਲੈ ॥ ਕਿਤੇ ਡੂਮ ਡਿੱਗੇ ॥ ਤਨੰ ਸ੍ਰੋਣ ਭਿੱਗੇ ॥੨੭੮॥
transliteration: Kite Ghaae Melai|| Kite Sain Pelai|| Kite Doom Dihhe|| Tanan Sron Bhigge||278||
translation: Somewhere the wounds are being inflicted and somewhere the army is being pushed; somewhere the bodies saturated with blood are falling on the earth.278.

gurmukhi: ੲਿਹ ਬਿਧ ਮਚਾ ਪ੍ਰਚੰਡ ਰਣ ਅਰਧ ਮਹੂਰਤ ੳੁਦੰਡ ॥ ਬੀਸ ਅਯੁਤ ਦਸ ਸਤ ਸੁਭਟ ਜੁੱਝਤ ਭੲੇ ਅਡੰਡ ॥੨੭੯॥
transliteration: Eh Bidh Machaa Prachanndd Ran Ardh Mahoorat Udand|| Bees Ayout Das Sat Soubhat Jujjhat Bhae Adand||279||
translation: In this way, the dreadful war continued for a short while and two lakhs and one thousand warriors died in this war.279.

gurmukhi: ਸੁਣਿਓ ਸੰਭ ਰੇਸੰ ॥ ਭੲਿਓ ਅੱਪ ਭੇਸੰ ॥ ੳੁਡੀ ਬੰਬ ਰੈਣੰ ॥ ਛੁਹੀ ਸੀਸ ਗੈਣੰ ॥੨੮੦॥
transliteration: Sounio Top Resan|| Bhaio App Bhesan|| Udibanb Rainan|| Chhuhisees Gadnan||280||
translation: When the king of Sambhal heard this, he, getting mad with anger turned black like the dark cloud; during the night, with his magic power, he, magnified his body to such an extent that head touched the sky.280.

gurmukhi: ਛਕੇ ਟੋਪ ਸੀਸੰ ॥ ਘਣੰ ਭਾਨ ਦੀਸੰ ॥ ਸਸੰ ਨਾਹ ਦੇਹੀ ॥ ਕਥੌ ੳੁਕਤ ਕੇਹੀ ॥੨੮੧॥
transliteration: Chhake Top Seesan|| Ghanan Bhaan Deesan|| Sasan Naah Dehee|| Kathau Oukat Kehee||281||
translation: With helmets on his head, he seems like the suns among the clouds; his powerful body is like Shiva, the Lord of Chandra, which is indescribable.281.

gurmukhi: ਮਨੋ ਸਿੱਧ ਸੁੱਧੰ ॥ ਸੁਭੀ ਜ੍ਵਾਲ ੳੁੱਧੰ ॥ ਕਸੇ ਸ਼ਸਤ੍ਰ ਤ੍ਰੋਣੰ ॥ ਗੁਰੂ ਜਾਣ ਦ੍ਰੋਣੰ ॥੨੮੨॥
transliteration: Mano Siddh Suddhan|| Soubhijvaal Uddhan|| Kase Shastra Tronan|| Guroo Joon Dronan||282||
translation: It seemed that the flames were rising and the king had worn the weapons like the Guru Dronacharya.282.

gurmukhi: ਮਹਾ ਢੀਠ ਢੂਕੇ ॥ ਮੁਖੰ ਮਾਰ ਕੂਕੈ ॥ ਕਰੇ ਸ਼ਸਤ੍ਰ ਪਾਤੰ ॥ ੳੁਠੈ ਅਸਤ੍ਰ ਘਾਤੰ ॥੨੮੩॥
transliteration: Mahaa Dhith Dhooke|| Moukhanndmaar Kooke|| Dare Shastra Paatan|| Outhai Astra Ghaatan||283||
translation: The warriors shouting “kill, kill” were coming near and with the blows of their arms and weapons, the wounds were being inflicted.283.

gurmukhi: ਖਗੰ ਖੱਗ ਬੱਜੈ ॥ ਨਦੰ ਮੱਛ ਲੱਜੈ ॥ ੳੁਠੈ ਛਿੱਛ ੲਿੱਛੰ ॥ ਬਹੈ ਬਾਣ ਤਿੱਛੰ ॥੨੮੪॥
transliteration: Khagadg Khagg Bajjai|| Nadan Machchh Lajjai|| Outhai Chhichchh Ichchhan|| Bahai Baan Tichchhan||284||
translation: With the sound of the collision of the dagger with dagger, the fishes of water were getting agitated and on all the four sides, the arrows were being showered violently.284.

gurmukhi: ਗਿਰੇ ਬੀਰ ਧੀਰੰ ॥ ਧਰੇ ਬੀਰ ਚੀਰੰ ॥ ਮੁਖੰ ਮੁੱਛ ਬੰਕੀ ॥ ਮਚੇ ਬੀਰ ਹੰਕੀ ॥੨੮੫॥
transliteration: Gire Beer Dhderan|| Ddare Beer Chderan|| Moukhanndmouchchh Bankee|| Mache Beer Bankee||285||
translation: Wearing beautiful garments, the warriors are falling down and on all the four sides, the warriors of charming whickers, were absorbed in lamenting.285.

gurmukhi: ਛੁਟੈ ਬਾਣ ਧਾਰੰ ॥ ਧਰੇ ਖੱਗ ਸਾਰੰ ॥ ਗਿਰੇ ਅੰਗ ਭੰਗੰ ॥ ਚਲੇ ਜਾੲਿ ਜੰਗੰ ॥੨੮੬॥
transliteration: Chhoutai Baan Dhaaran|| Ddare Khagg Saaran|| Gire An Bhanadg|| Chale Jaae Janadg||286||
translation: The arrows and swords of sharp edges are being struck and the warriors are moving inspite of the chopping of their limbs.286.
